title: Clean Beads & Joint Control
description: Practice torch angle, travel speed, and bead rhythm for neat joints.
tldr: A steady travel speed and consistent torch angle create clean, even beads. Focus on rhythm over speed.

sections.title: Torch angle
sections.body: Keep a 10â€“15 degree push or pull angle depending on the process. Consistency matters more than perfection.

sections.title: Travel speed
sections.body: Move slow enough for the puddle to wet both sides of the joint. If it piles up, you are too slow.

sections.title: Rhythm practice
sections.body: Use short, repeatable motions. Practice on scrap to build muscle memory before working on projects.

quiz.question: What happens when you move too fast?
quiz.explanation: Moving too fast prevents proper fusion.
